result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaiden Amarion Hopkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaiden Amarion Hopkins in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Jaiden Amarion Hopkins.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information rec'd and reading waived, not guilty pleas entered and accepted.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Order for Defendant to Submit to HIV and STI Testing

Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jaiden Amarion Hopkins appears via video and by Attorney Timothy Drewa via video.  Recess to allow a better video connection.   Reconvene.  Same appearances.  Defendant consents to video appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Court addresses State's application for testing under 968.38.  Defense stipulates. Court finds probable cause as to the request for testing and orders same.  Court will execute proposed written order submitted by the State.  Case adjourned for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Court grants request of defendant to appear by zoom for 9-01-2022 hearing at 11:15 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jaiden Amarion Hopkins
Current: 2329 Broadway St, Rockford, IL 61104 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 1402 60th St #5, Kenosha, WI 53140
No contact with LLB or LLB's residence Doc #9 deleted and rescanned as Doc #10
Application for Order for Defendant to Submit to HIV and STI Testing

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jaiden Amarion Hopkins in court and a special appearance by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender. State requests cash bond be set.  Court continues $2,500 signature bond with updated conditions.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  State requests a hearing on application and order for defendant to submit HIV testing.  State needs to file application  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Order for Defendant to Submit to HIV and STI Testing
Hearing set on 8/3/22 at 1:15PM in Br 3; Notice prepared 7/6/22

Other Jaiden A Hopkins appeared by video, in custody.  Other District Attorney Mark Bensen in court.  Attorney Edgar Beltran appears in Court for Mr. Hopkins and as a friend of the Court.  Court finds probable cause and sets $2500 sig bond.  Mr. Hopkins is not SPD eligible at this point.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
